Description: Fragment preserving complete profile of thin-walled cup with vertical handle; slight disc foot, carinated shoulder and slight vertical handle, roughly applied; buff clay with many red inclusions. Reserved except for silhouette decoration in tondo, a male figure in dark red, facing right; right arm raised holding a curved stick to which golden yellow 'clouds' are attached; a similar object on the right was presumably in his left hand.
Curator's comments: This small but widely exported group of bowls decorated with the figure of a ‘dancer’ is discussed by Jacquet-Gordon 1985 and has been attributed to Aswan as a production centre by Ballet 1996, 814 note 25; cf. also Hayes, pl. IV. Compare example from Oxyrhynchos: 1906,1022.1, 1906,1022.2, 1906,1022.3. H. Jacquet-Gordon 1985, ‘A group of Egyptian figure painted bowls of the Roman period’, in P. Posener-Kriéger (ed.), Mélanges Gamal Eddin Mokhtar, BdE 97, Cairo, 409-417. P. Ballet 1996, ‘De la Méditerranée à l'océan indien. L'Égypte et le commerce de longue distance à l'époque romaine: les données céramiques’, Topoi, 6(2) 809-840. J. W. Hayes 1997, Handbook of Mediterranean Pottery, London
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IE.08 bis)
